To do: Make fonts in Create stream UI more consistent
Description: Description
Screenshot after implementation: Screenshot-2022-03-05-at-12.33.41.png
@Alya Abbott Please share your feedback on the changes implemented in the screenshot.
Thanks! Could you try removing the horizontal lines and extra spacing between the options for each of the questions? I wonder if that would look OK.
It seems like "Announce stream" should have more space above it? It looks to me like there's more space below than above.

Alya Abbott said:

It seems like "Announce stream" should have more space above it? It looks to me like there's more space below than above.

Yeah i agree "Announce stream" should have more space above it.

@Alya Abbott Here i have

  • Removed the horizontal lines.
  • Reduced space between the options under the questions.
  • Provided equal spacing above and below "Announce stream"
    Screenshot-2022-03-05-at-13.15.47.png

Cool, thanks! Hmm, I think the horizontal lines were helpful, but I'm now thinking the second question should just be a regular dropdown. The great majority of the time people will just want the default option, so I don't really think we need to show the choices so prominently. Could you try the following?

  1. Re-add the lines for "Who can access the stream?"
  2. Change the answers to "Who can post to the stream?" to be the following dropdown options in the order below:
  • Everyone [this is the default]
  • Admins, moderators and full members [current option 4]
  • Admins and moderators [current option 3]
  • Admins only [current option 2]

@Alya Abbott Changes presented in the screenshots below:

  1. Reduced space between the options under the questions.
  2. Provided equal spacing above and below "Announce stream"
  3. Changed the answers to "Who can post to the stream?" to be the following dropdown options in the order below:
  • Everyone [this is the default]
  • Admins, moderators and full members [current option 4]
  • Admins and moderators [current option 3]
  • Admins only [current option 2]
    Screenshot-2022-03-06-at-17.39.41.png Screenshot-2022-03-06-at-17.42.38.png
This seems like a clear improvement. I think the word “organization” here is more confusing than helpful.

Steve Howell (showell) said:

This seems like a clear improvement. I think the word “organization” here is more confusing than helpful.

Can we replace "organization" with organization's name? For example: "Only Zulip administrators can post"

Let’s see what Alya thinks. I think it’s fairly obvious that the implicit context is that all options apply to the current organization, and the current wording might confuse users into thinking the second option is a superset of the first, which I believe is inaccurate.
@Ashwat Kumar Singh please use the precise option names I gave in my previous message, not other similar names. ;)

The options should literally be:

Everyone
Admins, moderators and full members
Admins and moderators
Admins only
Otherwise I think it looks pretty good!

Screenshot-2022-03-07-at-10.04.47.png
@Alya Abbott is this fine?
Yeah, looks great -- thanks!
Here is the PR for this issue: PR: #21335

Alya Abbott said:

The options should literally be:

Everyone
Admins, moderators and full members
Admins and moderators
Admins only

For the organization settings, we use Admins, moderators, members and guests instead of Everyone. I think we should change them to Everyone for consistency
Mmm, yeah, I noticed that we use Admins, moderators, members and guests elsewhere, and wasn't sure if it there was a reason. Changing it throughout sounds great.

Alya Abbott said:

Mmm, yeah, I noticed that we use Admins, moderators, members and guests elsewhere, and wasn't sure if it there was a reason. Changing it throughout sounds great.

Filed #21340.
UI looks pretty good; I've tagged this as a release goal just because of it being a close follow-up to the Create Stream UI changes we merged recently.
BTW, because this shares implementation with editing a stream's properties, be sure to manually test that UI as well when making changes here @Ashwat Kumar Singh
